file_content.text: Goodbye, Major.
Major! That was a fifty billion credit, top secret weapon! Have you lost your mind?
It seemed like the right move. My apologies.
I'm sorry.
You've got to be joking. You can't possibly be this dense.
I thought making the Voss happy was priority one.
You don't approve?
That doesn't mean you give them our most powerful weapons on a whim!
Everyone loves getting presents. Voss are bound to like us now.
That was top-notch diplomacy!
You can't be serious! I'd have you brought up for treason if I were willing to admit that it even happened.
I don't know which is more unbelievable: You handing over that bomb, or the fact that, after all that happened, the Voss still won't pick a side.
Ah, Major. Come in. Have a drink with me.
You did some truly fine work here on Voss. Not even Torius could stop you!
That was very impressive, Major. Even with Torius there, you got the job done.
I'm just glad things worked out, sir.
Thank you.
Well, more or less.
Did this situation finally swing the Voss our way?
What do the Voss think?
No, actually. It didn't.
I didn't do this for your praise, Senator.
Save the compliments.
Yes, I'm perfectly aware of that.
Unbelievably, even after everything the Empire did, the Voss refuse to take a side.
I'm sure you'll persuade them eventually, sir.
They'll come around.
We can only hope.
Don't they realize the danger we saved them from?
I can't believe it!
I don't know. But it's hard to believe our work didn't have any impact on them at all.
If those freaks want to burn, I say let 'em.
The Voss are insane.
I'm not ready to give up yet. Our work must have left some impression.
In any event, you've done your part. The Empire clearly won't be invading Voss again any time soon.
You're one of the finest representatives for the Republic that I've ever met. The troops are yours--and don't hesitate to contact me if I can do more.
I hadn't pictured someone like you as the leader of Havoc Squad, but you aren't all bad. I'll make the necessary arrangements to return your troops.
Those troops will make a big difference, sir. It's been a pleasure.
Much appreciated.
Take care out there, Major.
If there's nothing further, Senator, I need to move out.
I should be going.
I won't hold you up any longer. Good luck in your campaign, Major.
I'll never understand how someone like you could hold the rank and position you hold. But you and Garza can have your troops.
We'll make good use of them, sir.
Much appreciated.
I hope so. Goodbye, Major.
If we're through here, I need to move out.
Are we done?
Yes, I'd say we're through. I'm sure you can see yourself out.
Enjoy wasting your time with the Voss, Evran.
You're still a fool.
Hmph. Goodbye, Major.
Enjoy finding new ways to be even worse than the enemy we're fighting.
What are you doing here? You need to deal with the Imperials!
Rescue those commandos quickly, Major. The Voss are depending on us.
Major, good. Just in time to start the meeting. I'll need you right over there.
I'll help however I can, sir.
Anything you say.
I appreciate it.
Who are you meeting with, Senator?
What's this all about?
A representative of the Voss named Gon-Sa. The Empire is also sending a representative, Lord Torius.
I'm an officer in Special Forces, not a security guard.
This is ridiculous.
Get over it. You should be glad to get a break.
This meeting is critical--Gon-Sa, a representative of the Voss, has agreed to meet with myself and Lord Torius, from the Empire.
These meetings are a rare opportunity to impress the Voss. Just let me do the talking.
I'll stay out of your way, Senator.
Understood.
Thank you. I appreciate your help in this matter.
Did you say the Imperials are coming?
What about the Imps?
Yes--a Sith Lord, Torius, and his honor guard. That's part of why I need you here--to match his show of strength with our own.
My CO is going to be very interested in how much of my time you wasted.
Garza will hear about this.
Garza is your boss, not mine. She can think whatever she likes.
Senator Evran, sir. Your guests have arrived.
Ah! Welcome, Gon-Sa. On behalf of the Galactic Republic, allow me to express what an honor it is to speak with you.
I will hear your words. Speak your offer.
Words are all that the Republic can offer, my friend. Unlike the Empire, they lack the strength to do anything more.
[Say nothing]
Such hostility, my lord. You see, Gon-Sa--the Empire doesn't respect anyone. Joining them would make your people nothing more than slaves.
Unlike the Empire, the Republic defends and respects its allies.
That's incorrect.
Ahem, yes, my colleague is right. The Republic would respect and honor the Voss as equals. The Empire would make you slaves.
I have the strength to do a lot more--just say the word.
Want to bet?
Major... ahem, yes, the Republic has great strength. Strength that stems from mutual honor and respect among our members.
The Empire, however, doesn't know the meaning of respect. They want the Voss as slaves, not allies.
Pure slander. In the Empire, power is respected above all else--and the Voss are a powerful people worthy of high regard, Gon-Sa.
We have thrived alone for millennia. Why join anyone?
[Say nothing]
Many of the advantages to joining the galactic community you've seen firsthand--from the modernization of Voss-Ka to opportunities for trade.
The Voss could gain a lot by learning about outside cultures and technologies.
To gain knowledge.
Thank you, Major... yes, the galaxy is filled with amazing peoples and technologies. Your people stand to benefit greatly.
The Republic can protect you from conquerors like the Empire.
For protection.
We have defended Voss alone. You are not persuasive.
Gon-Sa. Problems have developed. You are required.
Problems? My friend, please--allow the Republic to help you however we can. Let us prove our worth.
Yes. The soldiers--they will help.
How can we help you, sir?
We would be glad to.
Yes. The soldier--you will help.
How can I be of assistance, sir?
I would be glad to.
I don't understand--is this a military problem?
Um... what?
I already have an assignment.
I don't think so.
My apologies, Gon-Sa! A small miscommunication--my colleague has no duty more pressing than aiding your people.
Voss commandos are trapped in Gormak territory. A rescue.
Of course. Proceed to the commandos' coordinates, Major. There isn't a moment to lose.
I'll have the Voss's men safe in no time, sir.
Understood.
What about enemy numbers, or the condition of your men?
I need details.
Our commandos live. The enemy is numerous.
You're really pushing me, Senator.
Back off.
I'll see that you are updated on your other assignment. Besides, this will be a simple operation for Havoc Squad.
Best of luck, Major. I hope the mission goes as smoothly as Senator Evran believes it will. Come, men.
Senator.
In the meantime, I want you back in my office. An important diplomatic meeting is coming up, and Havoc Squad would make an excellent honor guard.
I'll proceed to your office immediately, sir. Havoc out.
Understood.
I need to be in the field, Senator. This is a serious threat!
What about the bomb?
We don't even know where to start looking. Let the SIS do their job.
Soon as we have anything, Major, you'll be the first to know.
Havoc didn't come to Voss to waste time on your whim, Senator.
You've got to be kidding.
Major, I have the authority to cancel this operation at any time.
Now, hurry back.
Nicely done, Major--you turned a violent confrontation into a reasonable negotiation.
Those were personal credits, Senator. I expect to get paid back.
I want compensation.
Fine, fine. I'll have the funds transferred to you.
Well, you handled that about as well as I could've asked for. Although, I'm not looking forward to finding placement for Blex's goons....
Major, that was... impressive negotiating. After the fighting was over, at least. Good work.
I'm glad you were satisfied with my work, sir.
Thank you.
So am I.
Any ideas on where the Imps could be hiding the goods?
What's our next move?
They were aiding our enemy in wartime. I should've wiped them out.
I shouldn't have negotiated.
Wiping them out would've been completely unnecessary.
That was absolutely uncalled for, Major! You shot a man in the middle of a negotiation! Are you insane?
It got out of hand--won't happen again.
I'm sorry, Senator.
Good. The Republic can't afford to have its best soldiers slaughtering people left and right.
Smiles and kind words don't get results, Senator.
The job got done.
They don't if you never try, Major.
You might be on to something, Evran. Better watch what you say.
Maybe I am.
Oh, a threat for me, too? And you're supposed to be the Republic's best.
As for the information... what do you make of it, Agent Kellor?
Too early to say. Gotta run some numbers--try and figure out where they'd go with tunneling equipment and a bomb.
If the bomb is a ZR-57, you can track its radiation signature.
I may know about this bomb.
Good thinking. I'll get scanning equipment out to the team.
We need to give the Voss a heads-up on the situation.
Let's warn the Voss.
It'd be our word against the Empire's, with a known criminal as the only witness. We have no proof.
We know the Imperials have a dangerous weapon. We need to act.
I say we hit the Imps now.
The Voss would never sanction an attack on Imperial holdings without ironclad proof. We would lose everything.
Just give us a bit of time, and we'll get it for you.
What are you doing here? You need to find Pol Blex!
I don't believe there's anything further to discuss.
If you believe you can completely destroy the Empire's ability to invade this planet without being discovered by Voss authorities, so be it.
You'll work under my direct supervision, and I'll observe your activities through your armor-cam. Cross any lines and the mission ends. Is that clear?
This op will go by the numbers, Senator.
Affirmative.
I'm glad we understand each other.
My operations are top secret. Civilians can't participate.
I can't authorize that.
The Supreme Chancellor has authorized me to supervise all Republic activity on Voss. There is no higher authority.
I'll do things my way, and you'll sit here and like it.
No chance, Evran.
I have an executive order from the Supreme Chancellor himself. You don't. I'll be calling the shots.
Now. Take a look at these reports from the SIS--an Imperial agent called "Deadfall" has landed on Voss.
Deadfall's specialty is subterfuge--he sows confusion and chaos on a planet just before the Empire sends its invasion forces. His presence proves their intentions.
Do you know where he is now?
What's his location?
It's your party, Evran. Just tell me where to go.
If you say so.
So, the Empire's invasion plan is one guy with a scary code name?
Are you kidding me?
Obviously not, Major. I'm sure that this man is just one piece of the puzzle.
The SIS believes Deadfall is hiding in a cave system at the foot of Voss-Ka. The coordinates are in their reports.
I believe the best course of action is for you to search the caves for data, hopefully capturing Deadfall himself in the process. Agreed?
I'll make it happen, Senator.
Agreed.
Then we're already off to a good start.
I've started ops with less to go on than this.
It's as good a start as any.
I have the SIS working non-stop. As soon as I have new information, I'll tell you.
When did you get interested in military input, Senator?
You're asking me, now?
Input is always welcome. Sarcasm isn't.
Be sure to speak with my associate, Koru Tama, on your way out. He's working on some other matters I think you could help with.
And remember--I'm watching.
Ah! Major, please, come in. Make yourself comfortable.
I was just having dinner brought in--would you care to join me? I understand it's being paired with an excellent Chandrilan wine.
Much obliged, Senator, but I'm afraid the mission has to come first.
Thank you, but no.
Of course--you have a duty to carry out. I can certainly respect that.
While I appreciate that General Garza sent her best, I have reservations with her plan.
I appreciate that General Garza sent one of her best soldiers, but I still have reservations about this plan.
Military action here is very risky--the Voss have strictly forbidden violence between Republic and Imperial visitors. I maintain it would be better to wait for the Empire to make the first move.
A soldier never turns down a meal, Senator.
Sounds good to me!
Fantastic! I haven't dined with a soldier since the Senate Gala, some years back, when Supreme Commander Rans was seated at our table....
...Haha, yes. I learned to be very careful when greeting the Ugnaught ambassador. But it always pays to be careful--here on Voss, especially.
That's my reservation with General Garza's plan. The Voss cannot view us as aggressors. The Empire must make the first move.
If we wait for the Imperials to attack, we have to fight on their terms.
I respectfully disagree.
You don't want me here; I don't want to be here. Let's get this over with.
Don't try to play nice.
Hmm. A little civility is too much to ask for, I see.
The people of this planet are the most important resource in this war. We cannot allow them to be subjugated by the Empire.
If we're caught attacking Imperial personnel, we'll lose the planet to the Empire. We cannot make the first move.
If we sit back and wait, we'll end up fighting on the Imps' terms.
I disagree.
Is the ambush no longer an accepted military maneuver? It seems like a perfectly valid strategy to me, and the Supreme Chancellor agrees.
The first invasion didn't sway the Voss. What's another one going to do?
The Imps already invaded once.
The Imperials underestimated the Voss the first time. They won't repeat that mistake.
You're a Senator, not a soldier.
Who are you to judge?
Is common sense not available to both?
